author: Mangin, Jean-François
fulltext: 10.25493_ENJ7-ZKM;2019-12-10T12:41:54Z;https://doi.org/10.25493/ENJ7-ZKM;Maximum probability map of superficial white matter fibre bundles;2019-05-23T14:48:46.328Z;This data contains the maximum probability map of superficial white matter fibre bundles, in the MNI ICBM152 reference brain. These bundles were identified using a hybrid approach, incorporating anatomical information (from cortical regions of interest) and fibre shape (fibre clustering), from the tractography datasets of 78 subjects in the Neurospin’s ARCHI database. The maximum probability corresponds to the voxels with the highest number of putative fibres going through.;neuroscience;brain mapping;imaging;english;dataset;The Human Brain Project;Guevara, Miguel;Román, Claudio;Houenou, Josselin;Duclap, Delphine;Poupon, Cyril;Mangin, Jean-François;Guevara, Pamela;Mangin, Jean-François;NIFTI;Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International;https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuroimage.2016.11.066
name: 1fceacde-ae61-5dea-9a97-584b770e598e
notes: This data contains the maximum probability map of superficial white matter fibre bundles, in the MNI ICBM152 reference brain. These bundles were identified using a hybrid approach, incorporating anatomical information (from cortical regions of interest) and fibre shape (fibre clustering), from the tractography datasets of 78 subjects in the Neurospin’s ARCHI database. The maximum probability corresponds to the voxels with the highest number of putative fibres going through.
title: Maximum probability map of superficial white matter fibre bundles
